verses.t: Now Hiram{H2361} king{H4428} of Tyre{H6865} sent{H7971} messengers{H4397} to David{H1732}, and timber{H6086} of cedars{H730}, with masons{H7023} and carpenters{H2796}, to build{H1129} him an house{H1004}.

And David{H1732} perceived{H3045} Lordthat the {H3068} had confirmed{H3559} him king{H4428} over Israel{H3478}, for his kingdom{H4438} was lifted up{H5375} on high{H4605}, because of his people{H5971} Israel{H3478}.
And David{H1732} took{H3947} more wives{H802} at Jerusalem{H3389}: and David{H1732} begat{H3205} more sons{H1121} and daughters{H1323}.more: Heb. yet
Now these are the names{H8034} of his children{H3205} which he had in Jerusalem{H3389}; Shammua{H8051}, and Shobab{H7727}, Nathan{H5416}, and Solomon{H8010},
And Ibhar{H2984}, and Elishua{H474}, and Elpalet{H467},
And Nogah{H5052}, and Nepheg{H5298}, and Japhia{H3309},
And Elishama{H476}, and Beeliada{H1182}, and Eliphalet{H467}.Beeliada: also called, Eliada

And when the Philistines{H6430} heard{H8085} that David{H1732} was anointed{H4886} king{H4428} over all Israel{H3478}, all the Philistines{H6430} went up{H5927} to seek{H1245} David{H1732}. And David{H1732} heard{H8085} of it, and went out{H3318} against{H6440} them.
And the Philistines{H6430} came{H935} and spread{H6584} themselves in the valley{H6010} of Rephaim{H7497}.

And David{H1732} enquired{H7592} of God{H430}, saying{H559}, Shall I go up{H5927} against the Philistines{H6430}? and wilt thou deliver{H5414} them into mine hand{H3027}? LordAnd the {H3068} said{H559} unto him, Go up{H5927}; for I will deliver{H5414} them into thine hand{H3027}.

So they came up{H5927} to Baal–perazim{H1188}; and David{H1732} smote{H5221} them there. Then David{H1732} said{H559}, God{H430} hath broken in{H6555} upon mine enemies{H341} by mine hand{H3027} like the breaking forth{H6556} of waters{H4325}: therefore they called{H7121} the name{H8034} of that place{H4725} Baal–perazim{H1188}.Baal–perazim: that is, A place of breaches
And when they had left{H5800} their gods{H430} there, David{H1732} gave a commandment{H559}, and they were burned{H8313} with fire{H784}.
And the Philistines{H6430} yet again{H3254} spread themselves abroad{H6584} in the valley{H6010}.

Therefore David{H1732} enquired{H7592} again of God{H430}; and God{H430} said{H559} unto him, Go not up{H5927} after{H310} them; turn away{H5437} from them, and come{H935} upon them over against{H4136} the mulberry trees{H1057}.

And it shall be, when thou shalt hear{H8085} a sound{H6963} of going{H6807} in the tops{H7218} of the mulberry trees{H1057}, that then thou shalt go out{H3318} to battle{H4421}: for God{H430} is gone forth{H3318} before{H6440} thee to smite{H5221} the host{H4264} of the Philistines{H6430}.
David{H1732} therefore did{H6213} as God{H430} commanded{H6680} him: and they smote{H5221} the host{H4264} of the Philistines{H6430} from Gibeon{H1391} even to Gazer{H1507}.Gibeon: also called, Geba
And the fame{H8034} of David{H1732} went out{H3318} into all lands{H776}; Lordand the {H3068} brought{H5414} the fear{H6343} of him upon all nations{H1471}.
